sprint_goal: Establish the foundational security and user management framework, including login and Role-Based Access Control (RBAC).
key_deliverables: User login system; Role definitions (Groups); Model-level access control (ACLs); Record-level security for drivers.
demo_objectives: Log in as an Admin. Create a new user and assign a 'Driver' role. Log in as the Driver and confirm restricted access.
success_criteria: All security stories (US-058, US-001, US-004, US-070) meet DoD. Automated security tests pass.
risk_factors: Complexity of Odoo's security model; Potential for misconfiguration.
mitigation_strategies: Paired programming on security rules; Heavy reliance on integration testing.

sprint_goal: Implement core master data models for Customers, Drivers, Vehicles, Routes, and Materials.
key_deliverables: CRUD functionality for Vehicle, Driver (extending Employee), Customer (extending Partner), Route, and Material.
demo_objectives: Show the new menu items for each master data type. Create one record for each (e.g., a new vehicle, a new driver).
success_criteria: All master data stories (US-006, US-011, US-015, US-019, US-020) meet DoD.
mitigation_strategies: Early data model diagram review with the team.

sprint_goal: Harden master data models with comprehensive validation rules (uniqueness, format) and status management.
key_deliverables: Unique Truck Number validation; Driver license expiry tracking; Active/Inactive status for vehicles and drivers; GSTIN format validation.
demo_objectives: Attempt to create a vehicle with a duplicate truck number. Attempt to deactivate a driver with an active trip. Show an inactive customer is hidden from trip creation.
success_criteria: All validation stories meet DoD. Unit tests for all constraints are passing.
risk_factors: Complexity of regex for validation; Performance of active trip checks.
mitigation_strategies: Use online regex testers; Ensure queries are indexed.

sprint_goal: Deliver the core trip creation and assignment functionality with all business rule validations.
key_deliverables: Functional 'New Trip' form; Dynamic domain filters for vehicle/driver selection; Server-side validation for assignments; 'Planned' to 'Assigned' state transition.
demo_objectives: Create a new trip. Assign an available driver and vehicle, showing the status change. Attempt to assign an unavailable/non-compliant resource and show the error.
success_criteria: The full trip creation and assignment flow is functional and meets DoD.
risk_factors: Domain filter logic can be complex.
mitigation_strategies: Create comprehensive test data for all filtering scenarios.

sprint_goal: Launch the basic Driver Portal and implement core on-trip actions: viewing trips, starting trips, logging events, and uploading PODs.
key_deliverables: Driver login; Mobile-friendly trip list; 'Start Trip' functionality; 'Log Event' form; POD upload with photo and e-signature.
demo_objectives: Log in as a driver. View assigned trips. Start a trip. Log a 'Fueling' event. Complete the trip by uploading a photo POD.
success_criteria: All core driver actions are functional on a mobile browser.
risk_factors: Complexity of e-signature library integration in OWL; Mobile browser compatibility for file uploads.
mitigation_strategies: Early technical spike on the signature library; Testing on physical devices.

sprint_goal: Implement trip exception handling workflows (Cancel, On-Hold, Resume) and the foundational notification system.
epic_coverage: Trip Management Lifecycle, Monitoring & Alerts, Core System & Foundation
key_deliverables: Trip cancellation with reason; Automatic 'On Hold' status for critical events; Manager's 'Resume Trip' action; Core notification service (in-app & email); Audit trail functionality.
demo_objectives: Driver logs an 'Accident', show trip status change to 'On Hold'. Manager resumes the trip with a comment. Manager cancels a trip, show notification to driver.
success_criteria: All exception handling stories meet DoD; Notification service is functional.
mitigation_strategies: Use a robust message queue for notifications.

sprint_goal: Deliver the complete expense submission workflow for drivers and enable access to vehicle compliance documents.
key_deliverables: Expense submission form with receipt upload; Odometer validation for diesel expenses; File type/size validation; Driver access to vehicle documents; Driver cash advance request form.
demo_objectives: Driver submits a 'Toll' expense. Driver submits a 'Diesel' expense, showing odometer validation. Driver views and downloads their assigned vehicle's insurance PDF.
success_criteria: The full expense submission process is robust and user-friendly for drivers.
mitigation_strategies: Thorough integration testing of the file upload pipeline.

sprint_goal: Complete the expense management lifecycle with the manager's approval workflow and establish foundational financial master data.
epic_coverage: Financial Management & Invoicing, Driver Portal, Monitoring & Alerts
key_deliverables: Expense approval queue for managers; 'Approve' and 'Reject' actions; Driver compensation view; FASTag/Diesel card master data CRUD; Low balance alerts.
demo_objectives: Show the expense approval queue. Approve one expense. Reject another with a reason. Show the driver's compensation view reflecting the status changes. Create a new FASTag card record.
success_criteria: The end-to-end expense workflow from submission to approval/rejection is complete.
risk_factors: Complexity of stateful logic for low-balance alerts.
mitigation_strategies: Write specific unit tests for the alert trigger conditions.

sprint_goal: Implement core invoicing capabilities, trip profitability calculations, and customer ledger functionality.
key_deliverables: Auto-generation of draft invoices from trips; Trip profitability calculation; Customer ledger view; Payment recording against invoices; Expense policy configuration.
demo_objectives: Generate a draft invoice from a completed trip. Show the calculated profitability on the trip form. Record a partial payment against the invoice. View the updated customer ledger.
success_criteria: The foundational trip-to-cash workflow (excluding GSP) is functional.
risk_factors: Performance of the customer ledger for clients with high transaction volume.
mitigation_strategies: Query optimization and pagination for the ledger view.

sprint_goal: Implement the core high-risk GSP e-invoicing integration, focusing on the successful generation of compliant e-invoices.
key_deliverables: GSP API client service; Synchronous e-invoice generation workflow with asynchronous fallback; Updated PDF invoice report with IRN and QR code.
demo_objectives: Generate a GST-compliant e-invoice for a completed trip and show the successful response from the GSP sandbox. Download the PDF and verify the IRN/QR code.
success_criteria: The system can successfully generate a compliant e-invoice via the GSP sandbox API.
risk_factors: RISK-001: GSP API unreliability; Complexity of the GSP data schema.
mitigation_strategies: Heavy reliance on integration testing with the sandbox; Develop a mock GSP server for unit tests.
integration_windows: Continuous integration with GSP sandbox throughout the sprint.

sprint_goal: Build robust failure handling for the e-invoicing process and deliver key administrative configuration features.
epic_coverage: Financial Management & Invoicing, Core System & Foundation
key_deliverables: Alerting for GSP failures; Manual intervention workflow for failed e-invoices; System settings page; Session timeout functionality; Maintenance notification system.
demo_objectives: Simulate a GSP failure, show the alert and 'E-Invoice Failed' status. Use the 'Retry' and 'Mark as Manually Processed' actions. Show the TMS settings page and change the session timeout.
success_criteria: The system can gracefully handle GSP failures and allows for manual resolution.
risk_factors: Complexity of overriding Odoo's session management.
mitigation_strategies: Thorough security testing of the session timeout feature.

sprint_goal: Deliver the core manager dashboard with key KPIs and the foundational alert panel.
key_deliverables: Manager dashboard with Vehicle Status pie chart and KPI cards; Click-through navigation from widgets to filtered lists; 'Critical Alerts' panel with acknowledgment and navigation.
demo_objectives: Show the main dashboard populated with data. Click on the 'Delayed Trips' KPI to see a filtered list. Acknowledge a critical alert in the panel.
success_criteria: The dashboard is functional, provides an accurate at-a-glance overview, and meets performance NFRs.
risk_factors: Performance of dashboard data aggregation queries.
mitigation_strategies: Implement query optimization and caching where necessary.

sprint_goal: Deliver the export framework and the primary financial and operational reports.
key_deliverables: Generic report export to Excel/PDF; Detailed Expense Report; Core Financial Reports (Aging, Customer Revenue); Core Operational Reports (Trip Report).
demo_objectives: Generate a Detailed Expense Report, filter it, and export to both Excel and PDF. Demonstrate the Customer Revenue report.
success_criteria: All specified reports are functional, filterable, and exportable.
risk_factors: Performance of report queries on large datasets.
mitigation_strategies: Extensive performance testing with realistic data volume.

sprint_goal: Deliver advanced profitability and performance reports, and implement the automated expiry alert engine.
key_deliverables: Vehicle Profitability Report; Fuel Efficiency Report; Driver Performance Report; Scheduled jobs for vehicle document and driver license expiry alerts.
demo_objectives: Generate the Vehicle Profitability Report. Demonstrate a document expiry alert appearing on the dashboard after running the scheduled job.
success_criteria: All reports and alert jobs are functional and accurate.
risk_factors: Complexity of data aggregation for performance reports.
mitigation_strategies: Thorough validation of report calculations against a known dataset.

sprint_goal: Implement the full real-time GPS tracking feature set, including geofence management, live map view, and entry/exit alerts.
key_deliverables: Geofence CRUD interface; GPS data ingestion pipeline; Live map view with real-time vehicle updates; Geofence entry/exit alerts.
demo_objectives: Create a new geofence on the map. Simulate a vehicle entering the geofence and show the alert appearing on the dashboard. Show the vehicle's marker updating on the live map.
success_criteria: End-to-end GPS data pipeline and user-facing features are functional and meet latency NFRs.
risk_factors: RISK-002: Real-time data pipeline complexity and reliability; Performance of the live map with many vehicles.
mitigation_strategies: Implement DLQ and idempotent consumers; Use efficient frontend rendering techniques for the map.

sprint_goal: Finalize all data migration scripts, conduct full dry-runs, and prepare and deliver user training for a successful go-live.
key_deliverables: Production-ready data migration scripts; Successful and validated migration dry-run report; All user training materials (manuals, videos); Completed user training sessions.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate the execution of the migration validation script and its report. Showcase the driver training videos in the portal. Conduct a mock training session for stakeholders.
success_criteria: Migration dry-run signed off by Admin. All users have completed training.
risk_factors: RISK-003: Data migration failure/corruption; RISK-008: Ineffective user training.
mitigation_strategies: Mandatory dry-runs and validation; Pilot training sessions with super-users.
external_dependencies: Availability of users for training sessions.
burndown_target: Completion of all go-live checklist items.
